adventuring-gear.name: Abacus
adventuring-gear.description: This item will come handy whenever you need to do some calculus.

adventuring-gear.name: Acid (vial)
adventuring-gear.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

adventuring-gear.name: Alchemist's fire (flask)
adventuring-gear.description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

adventuring-gear.name: Arrow
adventuring-gear.description: Essential ammunition for bows, allowing ranged attacks.

adventuring-gear.name: Blowgun needle
adventuring-gear.description: Small, precise darts used as ammunition for blowguns.

adventuring-gear.name: Crossbow bolt
adventuring-gear.description: Ammunition for crossbows, designed for accuracy and impact.

adventuring-gear.name: Sling bullet
adventuring-gear.description: Small projectiles for slings, used to inflict damage from a distance.

adventuring-gear.name: Alms box
adventuring-gear.description: A small box for alms, typically found in a priest's pack.

adventuring-gear.name: Amulet
adventuring-gear.description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an amulet depicting a symbol representing a deity, the same symbol carefully engraved or inlaid as an emblem on a shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus.

adventuring-gear.name: Antitoxin (vial)
adventuring-gear.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

adventuring-gear.name: Backpack
adventuring-gear.description: Essential for carrying your gear, food, and other supplies on an adventure.

adventuring-gear.name: Basket
adventuring-gear.description: Useful for carrying or storing items, especially for foragers and gatherers.

adventuring-gear.name: Bedroll
adventuring-gear.description: Essential for a comfortable night's sleep during adventures, providing warmth and cushioning from the ground.

adventuring-gear.name: Bell
adventuring-gear.description: Can be used for various purposes, such as signaling, music, or warding off evil spirits.

adventuring-gear.name: Book
adventuring-gear.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

adventuring-gear.name: Emblem
adventuring-gear.description: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an amulet depicting a symbol representing a deity, the same symbol carefully engraved or inlaid as an emblem on a shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus.
